entry.title: 42nd Foundation Day
entry.summary: 17th of December 2022, Saturday, the NSS unit has arranged our Institute…
entry.content:
17th of December 2022, Saturday, the NSS unit has arranged our Institute Foundation Day. It was the day to remember, cherish, and recognize the students. The illustrious 41 years have seen SGGS contributing to society by giving ethical engineers and research insights. The institute celebrated it with aplomb in the august presence of Sant Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji, (Gurudwara Langar Sahib Nanded), Dr. P D Jadhav (Former I/C Principal), Prof. B M Naik (Former Principal), Prof. C B Deshpande(Former Principal), Dr. L M Waghmare (Former Director) & Dr. Y V Joshi (Director SGGSIE&T).

The theme for the 42nd year of our Institute is ‘|| तमसो मा ज्योततर्गमय ||’ presented by the NSS unit. The function started at 11:00 AM with a warm welcome of all honorable guests. Light symbolizes brightness and prosperity. It removes the forces of darkness and gives us positivity. In spiritual words, light means life. So, we can also think of light as giving us a new direction in life. With this noble thought, the function started with lightning of lamps & worshiping ‘Shri Guru Gobind Singh Ji’ by our guests.

Our Institute’s FSDC Club has performed Ganeshwandana & the cultural performance presented by Avaroh-The Musical Club. The program preface & the presentation on the history of our institute were represented by Dr. Mlind Bhalerao, Head of the ExTC Department.

After this felicitation of guest done by Dr. Y V Joshi, Director SGGSIE&T. 

The valuable guidance for students was given by Sant Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji. Dr. P D Jadhav brought back the memories of institute history in his speech. Prof C B Deshpande & Prof B M Naik shared their experiences along with students. Dr. L M Waghmare shared his experience in the institute and gave the advice to utilize and earn the knowledge of technical facilities that are present. Dr. Y V Joshi has expressed his thoughts on the 42nd Institute Foundation Day of our institute. He appreciated the organizers and all the student volunteer committees for organizing this event.

Thereafter the felicitation of retired professor, teaching & non-teaching staff has been done by our guests along with our director sir. After all the guest lectures & felicitation of a retired professor, teaching & non-teaching staff speech was over, Dr. P G Jadhav expressed a vote of thanks.

It was the day to remember, cherish, recognize for the students. The function has 
concluded by singing our National Anthem.

Glimpses of 42nd Institute Foundation Day ✨ -

entry.title: Alumni Meet 2k22
entry.summary: Life has many phases and the best part of it is college…
entry.content:
Life has many phases and the best part of it is college life . after many years coming back ….. It is the time when we have flashbacks with good memories and bad though. In our prestigious college , Alumni meet 2022 was organized on 23rd and 24th of December 2022 by our faculty coordinator Dr M.V.Vaidya and the NSS club of our college. 

In this we had great fun and time to interact with them . All together there were three batches of the year : 1996, 1997 and 1998. The respected alumni had a great time enjoying these two days . The best part of the event was that they truly inspired us with their words.

 The event started at 09:00. They had breakfast at 09:00 am arranged in the food court . The media committee of team Chitraksha had amazing interaction with the Alumni . We had a questionnaire with them , and they shared their memorable and beautiful experience. The moments and their memories were so wonderful. Talking about their experience, it was that for nearly after 25 years they visited the college and they used to have great fun banter with each other during that time. 

They said that the college has major changes. And they shared how the college helped them to build and how they are successful in their life till now. They had a very good conversation with us. Their memories had so many emotions filled with love , immense joy and fun. And they said those three four years were the best part of their life and having fun with friends was one of the major and the best part. In their time they used to have a ‘ Dev mama canteen ‘ in the college and one tree hill point  that was the place where they used to hangout and chill with friends. The alumni shared their college memories, mentioning the changes in the college campus, facilities, and atmosphere. They were really impressed to see the infrastructure and greenery of the campus. Speaking about earlier facilities they told us that the labs and libraries were available 24x7 that helped them to learn and explore. This is one of the reasons that pushed them up in their life. When asked about the college events they mentioned the Khojagiri Poornima used to be celebrated above the rooftops of their departments overnight. They also mentioned about the earthquake that took place. 

At 10:00 am to 12:30 pm they had respective departments' interaction with faculty and students. It was a great meeting with them. And from 12:30 pm to 2 pm they had lunch organized in the food court. And from 2 pm to 5:30 pm we had a felicitation program of 1996 , 1997 and 1998 batch alumni in the main function hall . The event's chief guest was Mr. Abhijeet Raut, Hon. District collector. The event continued by our hon. director felicitating our alumni with a memorable frame. The alumni also introduced themselves and their work. They all were successful personalities, who expressed their desire to participate in and partner with various initiatives of the institute. An Alumni association of our college was launched "SEAA" i.e. SGGS Engineering Alumni Association.

They shared so much about their life after and before SGGS . We had a cultural program from 7 pm onwards. It was so much and they enjoyed it a lot . They danced and many of them were singing songs . It was great to listen to them and see them enjoying . Still in their 40s they had such great energy and enthusiasm. They had lunch and after that they had a bonfire and they enjoyed very well. On the next day 24 December from 09:00 am to 12:00 pm they had a sports bonanza along with breakfast on the sports ground. They had many events and literally they enjoyed each and every part of the event. And at last from 2:30 pm they had a visit to Kaleshwar temple and Gurudwara.

Overall it was a great event and we all had so much fun!!

entry.title: Reliving College Reminisce
entry.summary: Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded. This video…
entry.content:
Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded. This video is made by Team Chitraksha especially for the fresh entrants who are missing out on the college in this online era of learning. Some of our beloved seniors who have completed their Engineering are here to share their exhilarating stories and experiences from their exquisite college journey. In this episode, the seniors discuss the environment of our college and their initial expectations and outcomes of their college pilgrimage. 

Reliving College Reminisce With 2020 SGGS Passout EP01

 

First day, Ragging and Seniors? SGGS Passout EP02

In this episode, the seniors discuss how was their first day in college and does ragging exist in SGGS. This is the Second Episode of this series
 

Which department has Hariyali? Events and Clubs? SGGS Passout EP03

How's Love Life in SGGS ? Favorite Place ? SGGS Passout EP04

Placement Scenario @SGGSIE&T, Exam life. The Final Episode 2020 Passout seniors.

In this episode, the seniors discuss Exam life in the college , Placement scenario of SGGSIE&T Nanded This is The Final Episode of this series

entry.title: Independence Day
entry.summary: Warm greetings to all the Maharashtrians. In the following years, may this…
entry.content:
Warm greetings to all the Maharashtrians. In the following years, may this state progress with new advancements.
Maharashtra Divas is observed on May 1 by Maharashtra residents. This day marks the 62nd anniversary of the Bombay Reorganization Act, which established the state in 1960. Maharashtra Divas was commemorated at SGGSIE&T as every year, beginning with our director, Dr. Y. V. Joshi, hoisting the flag.
The event was attended by all of the institute's faculty members, as well as students and security officers.
The Constitution provided us with faith, liberty, and peace. So, let us take delight in this day.
“आम्हाला अभिमान आहे, महाराष्ट्रीय असल्याचा, आम्हाला गर्व आहे मराठी भाषेचा, आम्ही जपतो आमची संस्कृती, आमची निष्ठा, महाराष्ट्र दिनाच्या मनापासून शुभेच्छा… जय महाराष्ट्र”

entry.title: Road Safety Workshop
entry.summary: A workshop for headmasters and sports teachers was organised on October 12…
entry.content: A workshop for headmasters and sports teachers was organised on October 12 at Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology on behalf of the Regional Transport Office and District School Bus Safety Committee. At this event, a street drama on driving safely was performed. A little over 300 instructors attended this programme.The street play featured students from Gnanmata English School and Nagarjuna Public School. Kumari Kstakshi Mahesh Chakrawar gave a speech regarding road safety.Dr Sunil Kulkarni gave a demonstration on First Life System (CPR). How to give life support to a person in case of unconsciousness or other causes of unconsciousness in an accident. To promote road safety, everyone in attendance took an oath. Deputy Regional Transport Officer Avinash Raut and Assistant Regional Transport Officer Sandeep Nimse gave guidance on road safety. Assistant Motor Vehicle inspector Vaibhav Dubbewar likewise planned the program and guided everyone regarding road safety.Rules 2011 guided the Principal.There is a District School Bus Committee at the district level for the safe transportation of students in the district. At the school level, there is a school transport committee. It was suggested that a school transport committee should be formed in all the schools and seating arrangements should be arranged as per the rules.The chief guest of the program was College Director Dr.Yashwant Joshi, Dr.Arun Kumar Patil, Rohit Das Basvate, Retired Principal Ashok Kamtane,Deputy Regional Transport Officer Avinash Raut, Assistant Regional Transport Officer Sandeep Nimse, Assistant Motor Vehicle inspector Vaibhav Dubbewar.

entry.title: About Team Chitraksha
entry.summary: TEAM CHITRAKSHA is The Official Media Cell Under Dean It Services of…
entry.content:
TEAM CHITRAKSHA is The Official Media Cell Under Dean It Services of Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology, Nanded.
The Main Objective of Cell Is to mostly entails covering numerous campus events and ensuring that every event receives the appropriate media coverage. The cell works to protect and advance the institute's mission as its primary goals.

Objectives of cell-

  • Ensure wide social media coverage viz. Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Pinterest of initiatives and activities of Institute.
  • Manage Photography and Videography of special events organized by Institute.
  • Overall management of all media related works of.
  • Provides content for the institution's website's recurrent.

This cell mainly provides a platform for students who wants to develop new skills and also want to upgrade themselves in photography and videography section.. We also give opportunities to students to come in the contact or handle the highly equipped devices such as professional DSLR’s and powerful iMac operating systems to assist in club activities. Moreover, students can gain a valuable experience and also develop many skills such as creative thinking, collaborating and also get leadership qualities in them which will help them in their future. They also get responsible by volunteering for the duties assigned to them during college events.
We hope that students gain a good experience, as well as support their dreams their passion for different areas of media. We also hope that we can influence people around us to appreciate the media in a better way, and also encourage them to take part in these activities as well. Chitraksha is all about engaging people in one bond through its boundless love.
